lead_paragraph: More than health care, race or the economy, Mr. Obama believes his efforts to slow global warming will be the most consequential legacy of his presidency.

byline.contributor: Julie Hirschfeld Davis reported from Midway Atoll, and Mark Landler and Coral Davenport from Kaneohe Bay, Hawaii.
byline.original: By JULIE HIRSCHFELD DAVIS, MARK LANDLER and CORAL DAVENPORT

headline.print_headline: ‘Terrifying’ Path of Climate Crisis Weighs on Obama
headline.main: Obama on Climate Change: The Trends Are ‘Terrifying’

snippet: More than health care, race or the economy, Mr. Obama believes his efforts to slow global warming will be the most consequential legacy of his presidency....
abstract: Interview with Pres Obama reveals extent to which he believes his legacy will be determined by what he has accomplished in fight against climate change; issue has not only showed heights of Obama's ambition, but also exposed some of his weaknesses, like inability to forge consensus even within his own party about best ways to tackle problem (Series: The Obama Era).

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Carbon Caps and Emissions Trading Programs
